Terms and Conditions for Job Seekers Using Daytal Platform

1. Introduction. Please read this page carefully. It contains the terms and conditions (the “Terms and Conditions”) governing your access to and use of the Daytal Platform (as defined below) provided by Daytal, LLC (“Daytal”) on behalf of the Employer. If you do not accept these Terms and Conditions or you do not meet or comply with their provisions, you may not use the Daytal Daytal Platform or Services. These Terms and Conditions are effective as of December 19, 2014.

2. Binding Agreement. These Terms and Conditions (as they may be amended from time to time by Daytal) form a binding agreement (the "Agreement") between you and Daytal. Your access to or use of the Daytal Daytal Platform or Services indicates your acceptance of these Terms and Conditions. You are agreeing to use the Daytal Platform at your own risk.

3. Certain Definitions. The following definitions apply to this Agreement:

3.1 “Daytal Materials” includes any materials, methodologies, implementation plans or other intellectual property used during the provision of Services.

3.2 “Content” includes all Text, Graphics, Design and Programming used on the Daytal Platform.

3.3 “Design” includes the color combinations and the page layout of the Daytal Platform.

3.4 “Document” refers to any posting to the Daytal Platform, whether job or resume.

3.5 “Employer” means the person or entity whose career and employment opportunities are promoted on this Daytal Platform.

3.6 “Graphics” includes all logos, buttons, and other graphical elements on the Daytal Platform, with the exception of paid advertising banners.

3.7 “Job Seeker” means a User who is accessing the Daytal Platform to search for a job or in any other capacity except as an Employer.

3.8 “Programming” includes both client-side code (e.g. HTML, JavaScript, etc.) and server-side code (e.g. active server pages, VBScript, databases, etc.) used on the Daytal Platform.

3.9 “Services” means any services provided by Daytal or its agents.

3.10 “Daytal Platform” means a recruiting platform operated by Daytal on behalf of the Employer and includes the Content, Text, Graphics, Design, Programming, Daytal Materials and Services (as applicable in each context).

3.11 “Text” includes all text on every page of the Daytal Platform, whether editorial, navigational, or instructional.

3.12 “User” refers to any individual or entity that uses any aspect of the Daytal Platform.

3.13 “You” or “you” means the person who (or the entity on behalf of whom you are acting) that is agreeing to these Terms and Conditions.

4. Intellectual Property Rights and Acceptable Use of the Daytal Platform and Services.

4.1 General Use Rules. The Daytal Platform is intended for individuals seeking employment and for employers or recruiters seeking candidates for employment. You may use the Daytal Platform only for lawful purposes within the stated context of Daytal's intended and acceptable use of the Daytal Platform. Daytal is the sole interpreter of the Daytal Platform’s intended and acceptable use.

4.2 Daytal Intellectual Property Rights. The Daytal Platform, the Daytal Materials and all right, title and interest in and to the Daytal Platform and Daytal Materials are the sole property of Daytal or its licensors, and are protected by United States and foreign copyright, trademark and other laws. Except for the limited licenses expressly granted to you in these Terms and Conditions, Daytal reserves for itself and its licensors all other rights, title and interest. Without limitation on the foregoing, you may not reproduce, modify, display, sell, or distribute the Content or Daytal Materials, or use them in any other way for public or commercial purpose. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, this prohibition includes: (a) copying or adapting the HTML code used to generate web pages on the Daytal Platform; (b) using or attempting to use engines, manual or automated software, tools, devices, agents, scripts robots or other means, devices, mechanisms or processes (including, but not limited to, browsers, spiders, robots, avatars or intelligent agents) to navigate, search, access, “scrape,” “crawl,” or “spider” any web pages or any Services provided on the Daytal Platform other than the search engine and search agents available from Daytal on such Daytal Platform and other than generally available third party web browsers (e.g., Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari); and (c) aggregating, copying or duplicating in any manner any of the Content or information available from any of the Daytal Platform, without the express written consent of Daytal. The use of the Content on any other web site or in a networked computer environment for any purpose is strictly prohibited. "Daytal," “Personified”, the Daytal design logo and certain other names or logos are service marks or trademarks of Daytal, and all related product and service names, design marks and slogans are the service marks or trademarks of Daytal. In addition, the "look" and "feel" of the Daytal Platform (including color combinations, button shapes, layout, design and all other graphical elements) are also protected by Daytal's trademarks, service marks and copyrights. Any code that Daytal creates to generate or display the Content or the pages making up the Daytal Platform is also protected by Daytal’s copyright. You must retain all copyright, trademark, service mark and other proprietary notices contained on the Content or Daytal Materials on any authorized copy you make of the Content or Daytal Materials. All other product and service marks contained on the Daytal Platform are the trademarks of their respective owners.

4.3 License for Use by Job Seekers. Daytal hereby grants you a limited, terminable, non-exclusive right to access and use the Daytal Platform only for your personal use seeking employment opportunities for yourself. This authorizes you to view and download a single copy of the material on the Daytal Platform solely for your personal, noncommercial use. You agree that you are solely responsible for the content of any Document you post to the Daytal Platform and any consequences arising from such posting. Your use of the Daytal Platform is a privilege. Daytal reserves the right to suspend or terminate that privilege for any reason at any time, in its sole discretion.

4.4 Other Specific Rules Regarding Site Usage. You represent, warrant and agree that you (a) are at least 13 years of age or older, and if under the age of 18 or the age of majority as that is defined in your jurisdiction, you will only use the Daytal Platform and Services under the supervision of a parent, legal guardian, or other responsible adult; and (b) will not use (or plan, encourage or help others to use) the Daytal Platform for any purpose or in any manner that is prohibited by these Terms and Conditions or by applicable law. It is your responsibility to ensure that your use of the Daytal Platform complies with these Terms and Conditions and all applicable laws.

4.5 User Submissions. Daytal welcomes your comments regarding the Services and the Daytal Platform and appreciates hearing from you. Please note, however, that Daytal does not accept or consider creative ideas, suggestions, inventions or materials other than those which it has specifically requested. If you submit feedback on the Services, please be specific in your comments and do not submit creative ideas, inventions, suggestions, or materials. If, despite this notice, you send Daytal creative suggestions, ideas, drawings, concepts, inventions, or other information (a "User Submission"), you understand and agree that the User Submission shall become the property of Daytal. User Submissions and any elements contained in User Submissions, shall not be subject to any obligation of confidentiality on Daytal’s part, and Daytal will not be liable for any use or disclosure of any User Submission. Daytal shall exclusively own all now known or later discovered rights to the User Submission and shall be entitled to unrestricted use of the User Submission for any purpose whatsoever, commercial or otherwise, without compensation to you or any other person.

Daytal acts as a portal for the online distribution and publication of User submitted information and has no obligation to screen communications or information in advance and is not responsible for screening or monitoring Documents posted by Users. If notified by a User of a Document which allegedly does not conform to these Terms and Conditions, Daytal may investigate the allegation and determine in good faith and in its sole discretion whether to remove or request the removal of such Document. Daytal has no liability or responsibility to Users for performance or nonperformance of such activities. Daytal may take any action with respect to User submitted information that it deems necessary or appropriate, in its sole discretion.

IF ANY ARE HELD INAPPLICABLE OR UNENFORCEABLE FOR ANY REASON, THEN DAYTAL'S MAXIMUM LIABILITY TO YOU FOR ANY NON-DIRECT TYPE OF DAMAGES SHALL BE LIMITED TO U.S. $200.00 IN THE AGGREGATE.

Because Daytal does not and cannot be involved in User-to-User dealings or control the behavior of participants on the Daytal Platform, in the event that you have a dispute with one or more Users, you release Daytal from claims, demands and damages (actual and consequential and direct and indirect) of every kind and nature, known and unknown, suspected and unsuspected, disclosed and undisclosed, arising out of or in any way connected with such disputes.

5.6 California Residents. If you are a California resident, you waive California Civil Code Section 1542, which says: "A general release does not extend to claims which the creditor does not know or suspect to exist in his or her favor at the time of executing the release, which if known by him or her must have materially affected his or her settlement with the debtor."

Changes will be binding on you on the date they are posted on the Daytal Platform (or as otherwise stated in any notice of such changes). Any use of the Daytal Platform will be considered acceptance by you of the then-current Terms and Conditions (including any exhibits thereto) contained on such Daytal Platform. If at any time you find the Terms and Conditions unacceptable, you must not use the applicable Daytal Platform any longer. Any new or different terms supplied by you are specifically rejected by Daytal unless Daytal agrees to them in a signed writing specifically including those new or different terms. Daytal may change the Daytal Platform at any time.

8. Indemnity. You agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Daytal (and its officers, directors, shareholders, employees, subsidiaries, affiliates, agents or advertisers) from and against any third party claims, actions or demands (including, without limitation, costs, damages and reasonable legal and accounting fees) alleging or resulting from or in connection with your use of the Daytal Platform, any Document posted by you, your use of the Services or your breach of this Agreement. Daytal shall use reasonable efforts to provide you prompt notice of any such claim, suit, or proceeding and may assist you, at your expense, in defending any such claim, suit or proceeding.

9. User Information and Privacy Policy.

9.1 When you register on the Daytal Platform or in connection with the Services, you will be asked to create an account and provide Daytal with certain information, including but not limited to, a valid email address (“User Information”). You acknowledge and agree that you have no ownership rights in your account.

9.2 All User Information will be used in accordance with the terms of the Daytal Platform Privacy Policy. Please note, as set forth in the Privacy Policy, that Daytal may collect certain User Information (including an email address and other contact information) and may use such information to contact Users periodically in accordance with the terms of the Privacy Policy, including to send Users electronic marketing and promotional communications, inform Users of relevant job postings that may be of interest to them, and provide Users with administrative notices and communications. Users can withdraw their consent at any time from receiving marketing and promotional communications from Daytal. In addition, as set forth in the Daytal Platform Privacy Policy, Daytal also will share your contact information (including your email address) with the employer on whose behalf Daytal operates this Daytal Platform. That employer may use your information to contact you directly, including by email, at the contact information you have provided. In addition, Daytal reserves the right to comply, in its sole discretion, with legal requirements, requests from law enforcement agencies or requests from government entities, even to the extent that such compliance may require disclosure of certain User Information. In addition, third parties may retain cached copies of User Information.

10. Questions and Notices. Questions concerning the use of the Daytal Platform should be directed to Feedback. Notices to Daytal should be sent to the address listed on the Daytal Platform. We will send notice to you at the address submitted by you or to such other address as Daytal reasonably determines is an appropriate address for you.

Access to the Content may not be legal by certain persons or in certain countries, and such persons have no right to access or use the Daytal Platform. If you access the Daytal Platform from outside of the United States, you do so at your own risk and are responsible for compliance with the laws of your jurisdiction. This Agreement is governed by the internal substantive laws of the State of Illinois, without respect to its conflict of laws principles. Jurisdiction for any claims arising under this Agreement or your Service Activation Agreement shall lie exclusively with the state or federal courts in the State of Illinois. The sole relationship between you and Daytal is that of independent contractors. If any provision of this Agreement is found to be invalid by any court having competent jurisdiction, the invalidity of all or part of a provision shall not affect the validity of the remaining parts and provisions of this Agreement, which shall remain in full force and effect. All provisions of this Agreement shall survive termination except those granting access or use to the Daytal Platform, and you shall cease all your use and access thereof immediately. You may not assign or transfer your obligations under this Agreement. No waiver of any term of this Agreement shall be deemed a further or continuing waiver of such term or any other term. Except as expressly provided by Daytal in a particular "Legal Notice," or material on particular web pages of the Daytal Platform, this Agreement and your Service Activation Agreement where applicable, constitute the entire agreement between you and Daytal.

12. Rules regarding Posting, Conduct and Security.

The following rules apply to your use of the Daytal Platform and/or the Services. The list of rules is for illustration only and is not a complete list of all posting, conduct and security rules.

12.1 Posting Rules:

(a) You may not post any Document to the Daytal Platform that contains: (i) URLs or links to web sites (to advertise your company or web site, see our Advertising Info page.); (ii) copyrighted material (unless you own the copyright or have the owner's permission to post the copyrighted material); (iii) trade secrets (unless you own them or have the owner's permission to post them); (iv) material that infringes on or misappropriates any other intellectual property rights, or violates the privacy or publicity rights of others; (v) keywords or white text keywords (including any words embedded in the Document and hidden from the User); (vi) anything that is discriminatory, sexually explicit, obscene, libelous, defamatory, threatening, harassing, abusive, or hateful; or (vii) anything that is embarrassing or offensive to another person or entity.

(b) You may not use a Document(s) to: (i) impersonate another person, living or dead; (ii) post false, inaccurate or misleading information, opinions or notices (commercial or otherwise) or chain letters; (iii) post advertisements, or solicitations of business (including, but not limited to, email processors, any pyramid scheme or “club membership”).

(c) Your Document(s) must contain sufficient detail to convey clearly to the Employer your qualifications as a candidate for employment. Documents that encourage the User to "email for more details" are not permitted. Documents from any third party charging a fee or restricting complete access to all resume information are prohibited.

(d) Resume postings must contain the accurate resume of a living individual seeking employment on a full-time, part-time, or contractual basis on his or her own behalf.

(e) Daytal is under no obligation to monitor the Documents posted on the Daytal Platform, but it may monitor Documents at random. Documents found to violate the above Posting Rules may be removed at Daytal's sole discretion.

12.2 Conduct Rules:

(a) You may not respond to postings by other Users in any manner or for any purpose other than that which is expected (i.e., to apply for the job with the Employer). Communications soliciting the Employer's business are prohibited.

(b) You may not send unsolicited commercial email to Users, including electronic communications that offer, advertise, market or promote a product or service.

(c) Protect your password. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your information and password. You are responsible for all uses of your registration, whether or not authorized by you. If others use your password to post inappropriate material on the Daytal Platform, you risk losing your access to the Daytal Platform. You agree to notify Daytal immediately of any unauthorized use of your registration and password.

(d) Report inappropriate postings or conduct to Feedback.

(e) You may not delete or revise any material posted by any other person or entity.

(f) If at any time Daytal comes to the understanding that you: (i) misled Daytal regarding your business practices and/or services, or (ii) purchased services that do not represent your precise business, Daytal reserves the right to terminate your Agreement.

12.3 Security Rules:

(a) Users are prohibited from violating or attempting to violate the security of the Daytal Platform, including, without limitation: (i) accessing data not intended for such User or logging into a server or account which the User is not authorized to access; (ii) attempting to probe, scan or test the vulnerability of a system or network or to breach security or authentication measures without proper authorization; (iii) attempting to interfere with service to any User, host or network, including, without limitation, via means of submitting a virus to the Daytal Platform, overloading, "flooding", mailbombing or "crashing"; (iv) sending unsolicited e-mail or other electronic communications, including promotions and/or advertising of products or services; (v) forging any TCP/IP packet header or any part of the header information in any e-mail or newsgroup posting or providing false or misleading representations in the sender information, subject line, locator, or content of any electronic message; (iv) altering transmission data without consent; (v) harvesting e-mail or other electronic addresses through automated means without consent.

(b) Violation of these Security Rules may result in civil or criminal liability. Daytal will investigate occurrences which may involve such violations and may involve, and cooperate with, law enforcement authorities in prosecuting Users who are involved in such violations.

13. Copyright Complaints.

13.1 Daytal respects the intellectual property of others. It is Daytal's policy to respond to claims of copyright and other intellectual property infringement. Daytal will promptly process and investigate notices of alleged infringement and will take appropriate actions under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act ("DMCA") and other applicable intellectual property laws. Upon receipt of notices complying with the DMCA, Daytal may act expeditiously to remove or disable access to any material claimed to be infringing or claimed to be the subject of infringing activity and may act expeditiously to remove or disable access to any reference or link to material or activity that is claimed to be infringing. Daytal will terminate access for Users who are repeat infringers.

13.2 Notifying Daytal of Copyright Infringement: To provide Daytal notice of an infringement, you must provide a written communication to the attention of "Trust and Site Security" care of TSST@Daytal.com that sets forth the information specified by the DMCA . Please also note that you may be liable for damages (including costs and attorneys' fees) if you materially misrepresent that an activity is infringing your copyright.

13.3 Providing Daytal with Counter-Notification: If we remove or disable access to content in response to an infringement notice, we will make reasonable attempts to contact the owner or administrator of the affected site or content. If you feel that your material does not constitute infringement, you may provide Daytal with a counter notification by written communication to the attention of "Trust and Site Security" at TSST@Daytal.com that sets forth all of the necessary information required by the DMCA. Please note that you may be liable for damages (including costs and attorneys' fees) if you materially misrepresent that an activity is not infringing the copyrights of others. If you are uncertain whether an activity constitutes infringement, we recommended seeking advice of an attorney
